--- title: "2023 Day 01" subtitle: "Trebuchet?!" date: 2023-12-01 categories: [python] draft: false # This doesn't work when I put it in _metadata.yml knitr: opts_chunk: comment: "#>" --- ::: {.cell} ```{.python .cell-code} with open('input.txt', "r") as f: lines = f.readlines() ``` ::: ## Part 1 ::: {.cell} ```{.python .cell-code} def first_value(line, m): for i, _ in enumerate(line): for text, val in m.items(): if line[i:].startswith(text): return val m = {c: int(c) for c in '123456789'} answer1 = sum(10 * first_value(line, m) + first_value(line[::-1], m) for line in lines) print(answer1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> 55712 ``` ::: ::: ## Part 2 ::: {.cell} ```{.python .cell-code} words = ['one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine'] m.update({text: i for i, text in enumerate(words, 1)}) rev_m = {text[::-1]: value for text, value in m.items()} answer2 = sum(10 * first_value(line, m) + first_value(line[::-1], rev_m) for line in lines) print(answer2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> 55413 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} :::

{{< meta title >}} Full Solution
::: {.cell file='solution.py'} ```{.r .cell-code} with open('input.txt', "r") as f: lines = f.readlines() def first_value(line, m): for i, _ in enumerate(line): for text, val in m.items(): if line[i:].startswith(text): return val m = {c: int(c) for c in '123456789'} answer1 = sum(10 * first_value(line, m) + first_value(line[::-1], m) for line in lines) print(answer1) # Part 2 words = ['one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine'] m.update({text: i for i, text in enumerate(words, 1)}) rev_m = {text[::-1]: value for text, value in m.items()} answer2 = sum(10 * first_value(line, m) + first_value(line[::-1], rev_m) for line in lines) print(answer2) ``` :::
Execution took 0.01 seconds
